Using UKB primary care prescription data

Source: vignettes/primary-care-prescriptions.Rmd
primary-care-prescriptions.Rmd

UKB medication presciption data are included in the Primary Care Linked data, accessed through the UKB Data Portal. The data can be explored online with SQL queries, the results of which can be downloaded, or the full table can be downloaded. We have downloaded the full table and converted it to an R disk.frame using ukbproject for fast local queries with ukbkings bio_record and bio_record_map. (See the article Access UKB data on Rosalind for a detailed description of the use of these functions to query all record-level data)

Contents:
1. Query prescription data
1.1 Medication codes
2. Retrieve antidepressant prescriptions
3. Other medication reference data
4. Resources


1. Query prescription data

bio_record returns a diskframe, an object which can be queried without reading the data into R.

library(ukbkings)

project_dir <- "<path_to_project_directory>"

scripts_diskf <- bio_record(project_dir, record = "gp_scripts")
head(scripts_diskf)

1.1 Medication codes

code meaning
bnf_code British National Formulary (BNF) is a reference book containing the standard list of medicines used in UK
dmd_code Dictionary of Medicines and Devices (dm+d), the catalogue of things that can be prescribed in the NHS
read_2 Read Codes (version 2 (v2)) are a coded thesaurus of clinical terms (used in the NHS since 1985). There is also a version 3 (CTV3 or v3)

BNF code:

UKB captures only the first few pieces of BNF code information: Chapter.Section.Paragraph.Sub-paragraph.Chemical substance, e.g., 04.03.01 tricyclic and related antidepressants, 04.03.02 monoamine-oxidase inhibitors, etc. Chapter 4, section 3 corresponds to antidepressant drugs.

BNF Chapter 4: Central Nervous System

  • 4.1: Hypnotics and anxiolytics
  • 4.2: Drugs used in psychoses and related disorders
  • 4.3: Antidepressant drugs
    • 4.3.1: Tricyclic and related antidepressant drugs
    • 4.3.2: Monoamine-oxidase inhibitors (maois)
    • 4.3.3: Selective serotonin re-uptake inhibitors
    • 4.3.4: Other antidepressant drugs
  • 4.4: CNS stimulants and drugs used for ADHD
  • 4.5: Drugs used in the treatment of obesity
  • 4.6: Drugs used in nausea and vertigo
  • 4.7: Analgesics
  • 4.8: Antiepileptic drugs
  • 4.9: Drugs used in parkinsonism and related disorders
  • 4.10: Drugs used in substance dependence
  • 4.11: Drugs for dementia


2. Retrieve antidepressant prescriptions

This is a ukbkings implementation of the extraction performed by Fabbri et al. (2021) Genetic and clinical characteristics of treatment-resistant depression using primary care records in two UK cohorts. (See the original paper’s code for treatment-resistant depression phenotype derivation, as well as antidepressant extraction)

To extract all antidepressant prescriptions

antidep_prescriptions <- bio_med(project_dir, chapter = "antidepressants")


This is equivalent to

# Antidepressant prescriptions

# Search by BNF code
bnf_antidep_prescriptions <- bio_record(project_dir, record = "gp_scripts") %>%
    filter(str_detect(bnf_code, "^04\\.?03\\.?0[1-4]")) %>%
    collect() %>%
    distinct()

# (TO BE COMPLETED) Search by Read 2 code
read2_antidep_prescriptions <- bio_record(project_dir, record = "gp_scripts") %>%
    filter() %>%
    collect()

# Search for remaining antidepressant prescriptions (captured by dm+d code?)
antidep_rgx <- str_c("^", drug_dmd_antidep$dmd_name) %>%
    str_c(collapse = "|") %>%
    regex(ignore_case = TRUE)

other_antidep_prescriptions <- bio_record(project_dir, record = "gp_scripts") %>%
    filter(str_detect(drug_name, antidep_rgx)) %>%
    collect() %>%
    distinct()


Medication dose


3. Other medication reference data

data source
drug_pharmgkb PharmGKB curated drug list (​https://www.pharmgkb.org/downloads​, drugs.zip)
drug_gwas ukb.gwas.medication.supplementary.data.1.xlsx - Genome-wide association study of medication-use and associated disease in the UK Biobank, Nature Communications
drug_dmd_antidep A curated list of dm+d antidepressant drug names from Fabbri et al.
drug_ukb Nested dataframe of UKB primary care drug coding maps

4. Resources

NHS prescription drugs - https://openprescribing.net/bnf/ - https://www.thedatalab.org/blog/161/prescribing-data-bnf-codes/ - https://digital.nhs.uk/services/terminology-and-classifications/read-codes - https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/areas-of-interest/prescribing/practice-level-prescribing-in-england-a-summary

ATC codes - https://ec.europa.eu/health/documents/community-register/html/reg_hum_atc.htm - https://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/ATC/?p=summary
